meanings.definition: The parts of the brain or the mind concerned with the reception and interpretation of sensory stimuli.
meanings.sent1: His sensoriums were overwhelmed by the bright lights and loud music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how the sensoriums process information from the environment.
meanings.sent3: The sensoriums in his brain threw a party when he tasted the delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: Her sensoriums danced with joy as she felt the warm sun on her face.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of the sensoriums at work in the human brain.

meanings.definition: The sensory apparatus of the body.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's sensoriums were finely tuned, allowing him to react quickly to changes in his environment.
meanings.sent2: The nervous system is responsible for coordinating the body's sensoriums.
meanings.sent3: His sensoriums went on strike, refusing to process any more information.
meanings.sent4: The sensoriums of the cat detected the faint sound of a mouse in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The sensoriums of the flower responded to the gentle touch of the bee, triggering the release of nectar.
